column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Dispose of Bacon Grease

#Text=Bacon — one of the most delicious foods in the universe — has a catch : you should n't pour the grease down the sink drain , as depositing bacon grease into any part of your plumbing system can lead to malfunctioning pipes and even sewage backup disasters .
#Text=So , once you 've prepared your mouth-watering strips of meat , what do you do with the pesky grease that 's left in the pan ?
#Text=It 's simple : throw your bacon grease away in the trash , re-use the grease to prepare another tasty treat , or try cooking your bacon in the oven to avoid the problem altogether .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Disposing of Bacon Grease in the Trash
#Text=Wait for the bacon grease to cool to room temperature before attempting to handle it .
#Text=Working with hot grease is a recipe for disaster .
#Text=Burning yourself with grease wo n't help you get rid of it any faster .
#Text=Not only can hot grease burn you , it can also burn through your trash bag or shatter a glass jar .
#Text=It 's better to be safe than sorry .
#Text=Allow your grease to cool for at least 2 hours ; adjust for more cooling time based on the volume of grease .
#Text=If there 's an unavoidable time-crunch for your grease disposal , you can line a cup with heavy duty foil and very carefully pour the hot grease into the cup .
#Text=Place the cup in the freezer , and later remove the foil along with the frozen fat .
#Text=Remove the bacon grease from the pan .
#Text=The amount of grease you 're dealing with will determine your method of removal .
#Text=If there is a small amount of grease to dispose of , use a paper towel to wipe it out of the pan .
#Text=For a large amount of grease , pour it into a sealable , disposable container .
#Text=Since your grease container is going in the trash , try to use a container that would not otherwise be recyclable .
#Text=If you do n't have a container you 're willing to part with , pour the grease into a dish and refrigerate until it solidifies .
#Text=Then , scrape the grease out into the trash with a rubber spatula , and conclude by washing the dish .
#Text=If you know you 're going to be eating a lot of bacon and tossing the grease , think ahead .
#Text=Save non-recyclable containers to use as grease-disposal vessels the next time you make a bacon batch .
#Text=Toss the grease in the trash !
#Text=A paper towel soaked with a small amount of bacon grease can be placed in the trash — or in your compost .
#Text=A disposable container filled with bacon grease can be placed directly in the trash , or solidified grease can be scraped out of a container and deposited in the trash .
#Text=Re-Using Bacon Grease to Cook a New Dish
#Text=Package your bacon grease for future use .
#Text=Strain the grease into a sealable container .
#Text=Use a cheesecloth or sieve to separate any leftover bits of food from the grease .
#Text=Then , label the container " Bacon Grease , ” and prepare to store it .
